Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: Draw different land habitats, such as a playground and forest, with recognizable features.
Draw different water habitats, like a pond and stream, including elements such as water and some aquatic features.
Include various types of plants, such as trees and bushes, correctly placed in appropriate habitats.
Include a range of animals, such as squirrels and fish, and place them in matching habitats.
Show comparisons by including different living things in different types of habitats, e.g., squirrels in the forest and fish in the pond.
CANNOT: Inconsistently use their drawing to show clear patterns in how different plants and animals live in different habitats (e.g., student might struggle with distinguishing why a plant is better suited to a forest compared to a garden).
Might overlook less common ecosystem elements, such as specific flowering plants or small insects, resulting in less diversity in the drawing (student focuses on larger, more obvious living things).
